page.title: 04Withy Growing. Kingsbury.
page.content: Today we went to see how the withies are boiled and stripped ready to be made into the finished product.Most withies are cut in November.They are taken to a shed,stacked in bundles and left to dry.When they are completely dry they are boiled in lots of 150 bundles for eight hours in a rectangular tank,and then they are stripped.Boiling them makes them go a golden brown.Some of the withies are cut in February.These are planted upright in 15 centimetres of water with mud at the bottom so that they can root and continue growing.These are stripped,about June,to provide white withies.Before you can make a basket with any withies you must let them soak in water for two hours,to make them pliable.
